attributes.action: Pay women who have paid reduced contributions a decent pension
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Women who have worked all their life and paid NI Contributions at a reduced rate, have consistently been robbed by government. I have paid over £70000.00 in contributions and my return in state pension is 10p per week. Women who have worked part time and therefore not paid any contributions are entitled to a full pension. How can that be deemed to be a fair system. This is particularly frustrating when you read of all the benefits asylum seekers and such like receive.   Now I am 60 and only able to get 10p a week who will be responsible for me, I do not qualify for any benefits as I paid reduced contributions, so I have to carry on working until my husband reaches 60 in 5 years when we will get married couples pension.  I would like the government to look into this matter again and do the decent thing and give us back some of their ill gotten gains.
